channel.title: Analog from a tonewheel Hammond with drawbars
channel.description: I have a Hammond L100 series (L110) and curious if anyone has used one of the direct out circuit mods to capture the essence of the organ into the Axoloti? I think it would be cool to have a system for live performance utilizing some of that.. Still learning, and still dreaming... I love this Axoloti Core and need at least another. :smile:

item.title: Analog from a tonewheel Hammond with drawbars
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

You can search the "drawbar organ emulation" thread. There are a few patches you can try. It would be nice to continue the tests begun by @johannes and @janifr .

Drawbar organ emulation AxoObject coding
Continuing discussion from http://community.axoloti.com/t/best-approach-for-additive-organ-patch/1638 http://electricdruid.net/technical-aspects-of-the-hammond-organ/ http://www.goodeveca.net/RotorOrgan/ToneWheelSpec.html Say, we put a loops of every tonewheel oscillator into sdram, if we 'd use 128 oscillators, divided over 8MB sdram, that 'd be 64kB data per oscillator, or 32kSamples at 16bit. If 48kHz samplerate is used for all oscillators, the loop length is 0.66 seconds, and all frequeâ€¦

Read full topic
